Primary non-small cell lung cancer without mutation in epidermal growth factor receptor (disorder)
Non-small cell lung cancer with mutation in epidermal growth factor receptor (disorder)
Primary reactive oxygen species 1 positive non-small cell lung cancer (disorder)
Malignant neoplasm lung: [of bronchus or lung NOS] or [lung cancer] (disorder)
Non-small cell lung cancer, positive for epidermal growth factor receptor expression (disorder)
Primary non-small cell lung cancer negative for epidermal growth factor receptor expression (disorder)
Anaplastic lymphoma kinase fusion oncogene negative non-small cell lung cancer (disorder)

Primary anaplastic lymphoma kinase fusion oncogene positive non-small cell lung cancer (disorder)
Primary non-small cell lung cancer, positive for epidermal growth factor receptor expression (disorder)
History of cancer metastatic to lung (situation)
Primary reactive oxygen species 1 negative non-small cell lung cancer (disorder)
pT2: Tumor of lung as per American Joint Committee on Cancer 6th Edition definition (lung) (finding)
Reactive oxygen species 1 negative non-small cell lung cancer (disorder)
pT4: Tumor of lung as per American Joint Committee on Cancer 6th Edition definition (lung) (finding)
Malignant tumor of lung (disorder)
Carcinoid tumor of lung (disorder)
Local recurrence of malignant tumor of lung (disorder)
Malignant carcinoid tumor of right lung (disorder)
Malignant tumor of lung parenchyma (disorder)
Malignant carcinoid tumor of left lung (disorder)
Tumor of lung parenchyma (disorder)
pN1: Metastasis in ipsilateral peribronchial and/or ipsilateral hilar lymph nodes, including intrapulmonary nodes involved by direct extension of the primary tumor (lung) (finding)
Metastatic well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor to right lung (disorder)
Metastatic well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor to lung (disorder)
T4: Lung tumor of any size that invades any of the following: mediastinum; heart; great vessels; trachea; esophagus; vertebral body; carina (finding)
T3: Lung tumor of any size that directly invades any of the following: chest wall (including superior sulcus tumors); diaphragm; mediastinal pleura; parietal pericardium (finding)

pT1: Tumor 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura, without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (i.e., not in the main bronchus) (lung) (finding)
Lung stage L3 (tumor staging)
T3: Lung tumor of any size associated atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis of the entire lung (finding)
Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor grade 1 of right lung (disorder)

pT3:Tumor directly invades any of following:chest wall,diaphragm,mediastinal pleura,parietal pericardium;or tumor in main bronchus<2 cm distal to carina(not involving it);or assoc atelectasis or obstructive pneumonitis of whole lung (finding)
Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor grade 1 of lung (disorder)
Lung stage L1 (tumor staging)
Tumor invasion into lung parenchyma (finding)
T1: Lung tumor 3 cm or less in greatest dimension, surrounded by lung or visceral pleura, without bronchoscopic evidence of invasion more proximal than the lobar bronchus (finding)
Lung stage L2 (tumor staging)
T3: Lung tumor of any size in the main bronchus < 2 cm distal to the carina but without involvement of the carina (finding)
T2: Pleural tumor invades any of the following: ipsilateral lung, endothoracic fascia, diaphragm, or pericardium (finding)
Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor grade 1 of left lung (disorder)
Lymphocytic pseudotumor of lung (disorder)

pT2: Tumor involves any of the ipsilateral pleural surfaces with at least one of the following: confluent visceral pleural tumor (including fissure), invasion of diaphragmatic muscle, invasion of lung parenchyma (thoracic mesothelioma) (finding)
pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed, or tumor proven by the presence of malignant cells in sputum or bronchial washings but not visualized by imaging or bronchoscopy (lung) (finding)
T4: Pleural tumor directly extends to any of the following: contralateral pleura, contralateral lung, peritoneum, intra-abdominal organs, cervical tissues (finding)

T2:Lung tumor with any of these features:>3cm in greatest dimension, involves main bronchus >2cm distal to carina;invades visceral pleura;assoc with atelectasis/obstructive pneumonitis extends to hilar region, does not involve entire lung (finding)
Primary well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor of lung (disorder)
Well-differentiated neuroendocrine tumor grade 2 of left lung (disorder)
Lung, attached tissue surgical margin, involved by tumor (finding)
T4: Lung tumor of any size with a malignant pleural effusion (finding)
T4: Lung tumor of any size with separate tumor nodule(s) in same lobe (finding)
